```{R} 
#| label: import libraries & functions
#| code-summary: (code) import libraries & functions
#| message: false
#| warning: false

if (!requireNamespace("librarian", quietly = TRUE)) {
  # If not installed, install the package
  install.packages("librarian")
}

librarian::shelf(
  dplyr
)
source("R/getData.R")
data <- getData()

# Count the number of rows for each Source
source_counts <- data %>%
  dplyr::group_by(Source) %>%
  # dplyr::summarise(Count = dplyr::n())
  summarise(
    NA_Count = sum(is.na(Value)),
    Valid_Value_Count = sum(!is.na(Value))
  )

# View the counts
print(source_counts)
```
